intro: Stillingia propria, commonly known as the Chinese stellaria, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes罂粟 (poppy) species. The plant features delicate, white to pink flowers with five petals and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Stillingia propria is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
